page.title: 11 Letham Glen
page.content: Letham Glen is one of Levens main attractions,this year it celebrated its 60th aniversary.We interviewed Mr Muszynski a park warden. He told us the Glen was opened by Mr John Letham who financed it and gave it its name. Previously the Glen was classed as common ground and called Spinkie Den (Spinkie_a Scots word for primroses) There was a swimming pool used by soldiers during World War 2 but it was filled in because of neglect.It was then converted into sunken gardens. The Glen is great for birdwatching, rare birds like the Siskin and Redpole can be spotted.In winter the deer, goats,guinea pigs,rabbits and donkeys shelter in their huts. The stream is natural and long ago provided power for Scotlands only ochre mill.This ochre was used to paint houses and mark sheep.
